result.execSummary:
The defendant John G Luke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex Registry Violation, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 301.45(6)(a)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: *Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge. *Comply with any and all counseling recommended by the agent. *Full compliance with the Sex Offender Registry. *Granted credit of 14 days if probation is revoked. *Probation may be transferred to Fond du Lac County.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Marquette County DNA Proof of Submission

Defendant John G Luke in court with attorney Jeanne Lila Zamzow.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee states plea agreement. Atty Zamzow agrees.  Defendant agrees and enters a Guilty plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis. 

 BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty.

Atty Zamzow makes sentencing arguments.

BY THE COURT:  Withhold Sentence; 18 months Probation with conditions:
Court Costs = $268.00
  DNA Sample + $250.00 Surcharge
Comply with any and all counseling recommended by the Agent
Full Compliance with the Sex Offender Registry
Credit = 14 days (only if revoked).

  **Court advises defendant that they have been convicted of a Felony and advises rights of voting privileges and of owning a firearm.

Atty Zamzow states that he is in Fond du Lac County and will report to probation there.
Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing
Return date on August 4, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant John G Luke in court with attorney Jeanne Lila Zamzow.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee states that in speaking with Atty Zamzow; the defendant will be waiving the Prelim today.  Atty Zamzow agrees and has discussed the waiver with his client.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees with the waiver.  Court accepts the waiver of the Prelim.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.

Atty Hendee files the information with the Court. Atty Zamzow states that the Defendant received a copy of the information and waives its reading.  Atty Zamzow enters a Not Guilty plea.

BY THE COURT:  Not Guilty plea entered.
Set for Return.
bond contineud.  Return date scheduled for August 4, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

*Comply w/Sex Offender Requirements
**Court amended the cash bond to a signature bond
Preliminary hearing on June 15, 2016 at 10:00 am.

with conditions:
*Comply with sex offender requirements
**Court amended the cash bond to a signature bond**

Defendant John G Luke in court with attorney Jeanne Zamzow.  Defendant John G Luke in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that part of the agreement is that the State agrees to amend the cash bond to a signature bond and the defendant will be waiving time limits.
Atty Zamzow agrees.
BY THE COURT:  Court will amend the cash bond to a $500 Signature bond with conditions:
*Comply with sex offender requirements  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 15, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on April 25, 2016 at 10:45 am.

Defendant John G Luke by video, in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.
Atty Hendee requests $500 cash bond.  Defendant requests signature bond.  BY THE COURT:  Court sets $500 cash bond.
Defendant does not waive time limits for the preliminary hearing.  BY THE COURT:  Set for preliminary hearing within 20 days.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 25, 2016 at 10:45 am.
Criminal Complaint served on Defendant by MASO
